title: Have I lost my 6GB profile?
content:
Hi there, I reinstalled TB (due to a Windows reinstall) and cannot restore my profile backup. I previously backed up my profile to a zipped folder using TB's export feature. I didn't see anything (or I missed any message) about the 2GB limit. But my profile is 6GB :( When I try to import the profile as a file it errors on being too big and instructs to extract it first. But I can't extract it, using with Win7 or Winzip as it errors as invalid file. I've also tried importing as a profile folder but errors with "Import failed unexpectedly" as I think its not expecting a compressed folder.

Is there a solution to this? What can I try? Is there another compression utility I should use to extract it first? Many thanks in advance!
creator: mozilla391

title: Incoming emails not being loaded into Thunderbird
content: I have been using Thunderbird as my email interface for a few months now and all has been functioning well. My environment is set up to automatically upload new emails on launch of Thunderbird. At approximately 14:30 on the 6th January 2023, the upload of emails into Thunderbird ceased, the 'busy' circle next to the pointer being displayed the whole time that it is hovered over the received messages. My emails are hosted by Vox (lantic) and I have checked through the web that in fact there are new emails that have not been uploaded to Thunderbird. Although I am able to send emails from Thunderbird, I get the message 'Your message was sent but a copy was not placed in your sent folder due to network or file access errors.' during the send process. The email is successfully sent to the recipient. I am running on a standalone home environment on a laptop.
creator: bones18

title: Multiple mails sent from one email address on a two email address account

What to do? How to fix? This does not happen to the other address associated with the account. Thanks for your help.

creator: SumoBot

title: Al intentar configurar Gmail en Thunderbird no se abre la ventana de "sesión de cuenta Google"
content:
Al intentar configurar Gmail en Thunderbird no se abre la ventana de "sesión de cuenta Google"

Es decir, siguiendo las instrucciones (https://support.mozilla.org/es/kb/thunderbird-y-gmail): "A continuación, selecciona Archivo > Nuevo > Cuenta de correo existente.... Thunderbird te mostrará el cuadro de diálogo "Configurar cuenta de correo". Cuando proporciones la información de tu cuenta (nombre real, dirección de correo electrónico y contraseña), Thunderbird configurará automáticamente tu conexión de Gmail. Haz clic en Hecho, abre sesión con tu cuenta Google si se te requiere y ¡ya está!"

En este último paso no se abre la cuenta de Google.
creator: SumoBot

title: Integrazione calendario con NextCloud 24.0.7 su un account con 2FA attiva
content:
Ho un account NextCloud, usavo il calendario di Thunderbird 102 senza problemi. Attivando sull'account NextCloud, l'autenticazione a 2 fattori (2FA), non riesco più a "vedere" i contenuti dei calendari da Thunderbird. Questo è normale e lo trovo riportato nel manuale NextCloud. Il manuale da indicazione di creare una app password apposita per il calendario di Thunderbird e di usare questa password per il calendario Thunderbird. Ho quindi resettato i calendari sincronizzati su Thunderbird, reinstallati usando la nuova password dedicata appena creata, thunderbird pare riuscire accedere all'account NextCloud, perché mostra tutti i calendari a cui posso "abbonarmi", il problema è che una volta selezionati i calendari, questi non risultano mai attivi e non posso quindi visionarne il contenuto. Il problema si risolve se disattivo la 2FA sull'account NextCloud.

Come posso risolvere il problema? É disponibile da qualche parte un log che riporti il problema per cui Thunderbird mostra i calendari come non attivi?
creator: nulll

title: Can never fully verify an account when creating new account
content:
Hi,

I use a siteground server and whenever I add a new account, TB recognizes the settings but when I click "Next" to finalize the process, it never completes.

If I try to configure it manually, I get an error saying "incoming server already exists."

To fix the problem, I have to exit TB and manually edit the profile file.

I end up adding:

user_pref("mail.account.accountXX.identities", "idXX"); user_pref("mail.account.accountXX.server", "serverXX");

Then I make a copy of another account's

user_pref("mail.identity.idXX.XXX"

settings and make them fit the new account.

As you can guess, it's pretty tedious and annoying but I don't understand why this happens.

Any ideas?

L

title: Thunderbird repeatedly resets a stored certificate "security exception" TB 102.6.1 (64-bit) on Win10
content: There is no mystery to what's happening here. Programming 101: a security exception doesn't get reset every 2 or 3 passes unless some malicious or incompetent programmer set up a countdown loop to reset it. And who would do that kind of thing to users unless some malicious jerk wants to pressure the users into fighting his or her political programming battles with other net entities? I turn 77 this month, and last year had a tumor removed from inside my spinal cord that, while slow-growing and essentially benign, caused horrific pain. People my age and condition save our energy for things that really matter to us. That doesn't include Lilliputian battles over which end of the egg to open. So suck up your egos and resolve this among each other.
creator: business11
